title: Africa: Blinken's Trip Signals Growing U.S. Concern Amid Six Simultaneous Crises Across Africa
description: [African Security Research Project] Washington, DC -- US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's trip to four African countries - Cape Verde, Cote d'Ivoire, Nigeria, and Angola - on January 21-26, 2024, demonstrates just how worried US policymakers are about recent developments in Africa.

title: Africa: Hage Geingob - Namibian President Who Played a Modernising Role
description: [The Conversation Africa] Hage Gottfried Geingob served as the third president of Namibia from 2015 until his death on February 4 2024. He was Namibia's first prime minister from 1990 to 2002, and served as prime minister again from 2012 to 2015.

title: Africa: South Africa's Military Is Expected to Do More Than Ever With Tighter Budgets - How the Force Has Declined Over 30 Years
description: [The Conversation Africa] The South African National Defence Force marks 30 years this year, having been established on 27 April 1994. It's as old as the country's constitutional democracy, the result of a negotiated political settlement that ended apartheid. The defence force consists of the army, air force, navy, and military health service.

title: Africa: Grammy Awards 2024 - 'Afro Beat' Gets Due Recognition After 65 Years
description: [New Times] For the first time in its 65-year  history, the prestigious Grammy Awards in the US has created the 'Best African Music Performance category', specifically recognizing the song of the year from the continent.

title: Africa: Exiting Ecowas and Its Implications for Niger, Mali, Burkina Faso, West Africa
description: [Premium Times] "ECOWAS, under the influence of foreign powers, betraying its founding principles, has become a threat to its member state..." Niger, Mali and Burkina Faso said.

title: Africa: All The Grammys Winners
description: [Vanguard] The 66th 2024 Grammys is ongoing today, February 4th, 2024. SZA has the most nominations with a total of nine, followed by Phoebe Bridgers, recording engineer Serban Ghenea, and Victoria Monét, who each have seven. Jack Antonoff, Jon Batiste, Brandy Clark, Miley Cyrus, Billie Eilish, Olivia Rodrigo, and Taylor Swift have six nominations each.

title: Africa: South African Star Tyla's Grammy Win Sets Tone Ahead of Afcon Semi-Final Showdown
description: [Vanguard] To some critics, this is a forestaste of what Nigerians should expect on Wednesday, gloating that South Africa are already in an early lead ahead of the AFCON semi-final clash against Nigeria.

title: Africa: AU - EU Health Dialogue On Strengthening Health Partnership Between Africa and Europe
description: [African Union] What: High level dialogue and media briefing between the African Union Commission and the European Union to Strengthen Health Partnership between Africa and Europe

title: Africa: Why the World Should Not Ignore Refugee Crisis
